FuncDef:
The loopback command enables loopback on an Ethernet interface.
The undo loopback command disables loopback.
By default, loopback is disabled on Ethernet interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies local loopback.
Local loopback means that a packet from an interface is sent back to this interface inside the system.
-

Specifies remote loopback.
Remote loopback means that the local interface sends a packet from the peer interface (remote end) back to the peer interface rather than forward the packet to the destination address.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you want to locate a system fault, run the loopback local command to enable local loopback.If you want to locate a link fault or test the quality of a link, run the loopback remote command to enable remote loopback on a interface.

Configuration Impact
In normal situations, interfaces are not allowed to work in loopback mode; otherwise, traffic is looped, causing service interruption.
Precautions
When local loopback is enabled on a interface, the interface physically goes Up, but its link layer protocol goes Down.
When a interface is physically Up and a serial interface channelized from the interface is encapsulated with PPP, the link layer protocol of the serial interface goes Down after remote loopback is enabled on the remote device.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
In the serial interface view,if the RS-485 mode is configured, the loopback remote command is not supported.
